input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: ULHÓWEK COMMUNE. Summary: Conducting Classes and Workshops as Part of the Knowledge and Competence Development Academy Project. Description: Handicraft workshops for 40 people - 4 groups x 4 h x 10 workshops, a total of 160 hours. The task includes the following activities: Implementation of handicraft workshops - a total of 160 hours. The trainer's task will be to create artistic works, taking into account cultivation old folk traditions. They also aim to develop manual skills through activities in the field of artistic crafts (handicrafts), create opportunities to deepen one's interests and expand general knowledge. A trainer's working hour is considered to be one hour clocks - 60 minutes, classes may be held on working days and possibly on Saturdays and Sundays, depending on the needs of the project participant. Description: 1. The subject of the order is the comprehensive organization and implementation of training in the field of second-cycle specialization in the profession of a social worker, specializing in: social work with individuals and families with the problem of violence, along with the fee for the examination as part of the project titled "Coordination of social policy in the Witokrzyskie Voivodeship. 2. As part of the subject of the order, the Contractor will be obliged to: providing training participants with breakfast, lunch and dinner, all-day coffee service along with the delivery and service of lunches and coffee services to the place where the training will take place. 5. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: NATIONAL CENTER FOR RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT. Summary: Providing Training Services by Organizing and Conducting Training/Workshops for Participants of the "Science4Business - Science for Business" Project. Description: 1. The subject of the order is the provision of a training service by organizing and conducting training/workshops for participants of the "Science4Business - Science for business" project (project no.: FENG.02.05-IP.07-0002/24, hereinafter referred to as: "S4B" or "Design"). Training and workshops will be organized as part of task no. 2 "Technology transfer staff", implemented by the National Center for Research and Development as part of the above-mentioned Project. The aim of task no. 2 is to build a specialized training program and workshops for employees of Technology Transfer Centers (CTT) and Special Purpose Vehicles (SC), including managers involved in technology transfer, and training of current staff to fill competence gaps. There will be a training program adapted to the level of knowledge and experience of training and workshop participants. As part of the order, there will be 3 editions/cycles of training for CTT and SC employees. Within each edition/series, the following will be conducted in parallel: •training for non-performing employees managerial functions. They will be implemented at 3 levels of advancement (basic, intermediate and advanced). Each cycle will last from four to thirteen months. The exact duration of each cycle will be agreed jointly by the Contractor and NCBR after signing the contract i •separate workshops for CTT/SC management staff. In all three editions/cycles, a total of 400 training places are planned for non-managerial employees and 100.... Published Date: 2025-12-18. Closing Date: 2026-01-08. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: POMERANIAN VOIVODESHIP. Summary: Preparation and Conduct of Training in Accordance with the Provisions of the Regulation of the Council of Ministers of March 30, 2020 on Training for Employees of the Social Service Center. Description: 1. The subject of the order is the service of preparing and conducting training in accordance with the provisions of the Regulation of the Council of Ministers of March 30, 2020 on training for employees of social services centers (Journal of Laws of 2020, item 664) in the voivodeship Pomeranian Voivodeship, including: •Module I - training in the management and organization of social services, 60 hours; •Module II - training in the development and implementation of individual social service plans, 52 hours; •Module III - training in local community organization, 57 hours. 2. A detailed description of the subject of the order is specified in Annex No. 1 to the SWZ and in the contract template, which constitutes Annex No. 2 to the SWZ. The Ordering Party provides for the application of law option referred to in Art. 441 of the Public Procurement Law, in a situation where the number of people willing to participate in individual training modules significantly exceeds the number of participants assumed by the Ordering Party. The option assumes an increase in the subject of the order by a maximum of 6 additional training courses (in the scope of module I, II or III, depending on demand), while maintaining the gross unit price per person indicated for the basic order, taking into account that the option will be implemented within 12 months from the date of conclusion of the contract. The option right will mean that the Ordering Party may commission the organization of additional training, but the Contractor is not entitled to any claim against the Ordering Party.... Summary: Organizing and Conducting Classes to Equalize Educational Opportunities - Mathematics Tutoring for Children - Participants of the Łęczycka Rodzina Project. Description: Conducting mathematics tutoring.1. The aim of the tutoring is to fully understand and consolidate the thematic material for 15 children who have problems with mastering the material.2. Duration of tutoring within 20 months from the date of conclusion of the contract. One hour lesson time = 1 clock hour. Tutoring will be conducted for 2 hours twice a week, subject to the possibility of changing the number of participants taking part in tutoring and the number of hours per week. 320 hours in total.3. Project participants, directed to participate in tutoring, attend primary schools. There are also disabled people among the participants taking part in tutoring.4. Tutors will conduct classes both individually and in groups.5. The same tutor can provide tutoring both one person and several people.6. He or she may conduct classes in one or several subjects, provided that he or she has appropriate qualifications and education.7. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: ENEA OPERATOR SP. Z O.O.. Summary: Reconstruction of the 110/15 Kv Wyrzysk [Wyr] Station Along with the Reconstruction of Existing Hv and Mv Line Connections (S-2025-07577). Description: The subject of the order is the implementation of a task including design, delivery, assembly, construction, commissioning and commissioning of the 110/15 kV Wyrzysk [WYR] double-transformer station, hereinafter referred to as GPZ WYRZYSK, along with the demolition of the existing station and restoration of existing HV and MV linear connections. The construction of the new station will functionally replace the currently operating GPZ WYRZYSK, which is scheduled for demolition, and will increase the available connection capacity in the region. In order to carry out the work, you must obtain all opinions, arrangements, consents, decisions, permits, notifications, etc. required by applicable law. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: PROVINCIAL SPECIALIST HOSPITAL IN WROCŁAW. Summary: Delivery of an Erp-Class Hospital it System with Implementation Service, Licensing, Provision of Warranty Services, Author'S Supervision and Service, as Well as User Training - Repeat. Description: 1. The subject of the order is the supply of a Hospital IT System (hereinafter referred to as the "System"), consisting of an ERP class system (hereinafter referred to as the "ERP System") containing or supplemented with programs integrated with it, providing support for work in the areas functionalities specified in the Offer and OPZ, together with the implementation service, granting a license, providing warranty services, author's supervision and service, as well as user training for the Provincial Specialist Hospital in Wrocław. 2. Subject orders include: 1) Stage I - Pre-implementation analysis, a) analysis of functionalities and business processes, in particular functionalities and business processes at the interface of the new System with other systems used by the Ordering Party, in order to developing the best possible method of implementing business processes and system integration, b) developing a detailed Implementation Schedule, c) preparation of the Project Initiation Document (DIP), d) preparation of Pre-Implementation Analysis Documentation (DAP), 2) Stage II - Delivery of the offered System (including ERP) along with the database* necessary for its launch and granting a license, as well as providing licenses for other programs required for the operation of the System**. 3) Stage III - Implementation the offered System, including: a) Installation for the implementation of the test, training and production instances of the System, b) Configuration, parameterization, adaptation of the System in a manner consistent with the OPZ and the assumptions of the Pre-Implementation Analysis.... Published Date: 2025-12-16. Closing Date: 2025-12-23. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: POMERANIAN TEACHER EDUCATION CENTER IN GDAŃSK. Summary: Comprehensive Organization of a National Study Visit. Description: 1. The subject of the order is the comprehensive organization of a national study visit to the Greater Poland Voivodeship for a group of approximately 30 participants, including career advisors and employees of institutions involved in activities in the field of career counseling and coordination of regional educational activities. 2. The order includes in particular: 1) providing bus transport on the Gdańsk - Greater Poland Voivodeship - Gdańsk route, including local transport services, 2)reservation and provision of accommodation for two nights in a hotel with a minimum three-star standard, 3) provision of full board including breakfasts, lunches, dinners, coffee breaks and an official dinner, 4) organizing a substantive program of the visit covering at least four meetings study in institutions operating in the field of career counseling, 5) preparation of the cultural and cognitive part consistent with the topic of the visit, 6) insurance of participants regarding the consequences of accidents and medical costs, 7) assurance a coordinator responsible for the course of the visit and ongoing contact with the Ordering Party. 3.The visit is planned for March 2026 and will last three days, from Wednesday to Friday. 4. The detailed program and schedule will be agreed between the Ordering Party and the contractor within 14 business days from the date of signing the contract. 5. A detailed description of the subject of the order is attached as Appendix No. 1 to the SWZ. 6. The Ordering Party does not allow the submission of partial offers. 7.The contractor may entrust.... input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: SILESIAN UNIVERSITY OF TECHNOLOGY. Summary: Digital E-Learning Training on Awareness of Special Needs, Including Disabilities, and Rules for Ensuring Accessibility at the University. Case Reference Number: Dzpz.283.102.2025.Al. Description: 1. The subject of the order is a service consisting in the development, preparation and delivery of personalized e-learning training in digital form, regarding awareness of special needs, including disabilities and the principles of ensuring accessibility, in accordance with with the scope specified by the Ordering Party. The training will be used within the internal educational activities of the University, the recipients of the training will be newly employed employees and people holding managerial positions. The aim of the training is to obtain basic knowledge about special needs, including disabilities, and the principles of ensuring accessibility at the University. The training is intended to help build an inclusive academic environment and improve the comfort of studying among people with disabilities and special needs. needs. The training must be made available in digital form, in the form of a recorded video. It must be prepared in Polish with the possibility of including subtitles in English or Polish and is to be translated into Polish Sign Language (PJM). Recorded duration training: 90 minutes.2. Order completion date: up to 4 months from the date of conclusion of the contract.. Published Date: 2025-12-16. Closing Date: 2026-01-08. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: REGIONAL CENTER FOR SOCIAL POLICY IN KRAKOW. Summary: Conducting Supervision for Staff Employed in Entities Working for Social Inclusion in Małopolska. Description: 1. The subject of the order is a service consisting in conducting supervision for staff employed in entities working for social inclusion in Maopolska.2. As part of the order, the Contractor will conduct supervision for 15 supervision groups, 48 ​​hours each supervision for each group (12 meetings of 4 hours each), i.e. a total of 720 supervision hours. 1 supervision hour = 45 minutes. Meetings for one group are planned to be held once a month, but at least once every 3 weeks.3. The service will stay carried out in the form of direct contact, on working days, from between 7:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m., in places indicated by the Ordering Party, i.e. communes located in the Maopolskie Voivodeship.4. The size of the supervision group is approximately 12 people. Ordering party allows for the possibility of increasing the size of the group if it is justified by the needs of the entity benefiting from supervision. The full description of the subject of the order and the method of providing the service can be found in the description of the subject of the order constituting Annex No. 2 to the SWZ and the contract template constituting Annex No. 3 to the SWZ.. Published Date: 2025-12-12. Closing Date: 2025-12-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: LUBUSKIE VOIVODESHIP REGIONAL CENTER FOR SOCIAL POLICY IN ZIELONA GORA. Summary: Organization and Conduct of Training as Part of the Project Entitled "The Synergy Effect - Coordination of Social Inclusion in Lubuskie Voivodeship", Divided into Parts. Description: Part A. Conducting individual and/or group supervision for employees of Social Service Centers (CUS) from the Lubuskie Voivodeship. Supervisions will be conducted for employees of 18 CUSs, 30 hours of supervision for each center (5 meetings of 6 hours each), i.e. in total: 540 hours of supervision, 1 supervision hour = 60 minutes. It is planned that meetings for one CUS will be held once a month, but at least once every 5 weeks. The service will be provided in the communes of the Lubuskie Voivodeship where CUSs operate, as indicated by the Ordering Party. The Contractor will determine the meeting place with a representative of a given CUS and present it to the Ordering Party for approval. Published Date: 2025-12-10. Closing Date: 2025-12-17. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Summary: Providing Training Services by Organizing and Conducting Training/Workshops for Participants of the "Science4business - Science for Business" Project. Description: 1. The subject of the order is the provision of a training service by organizing and conducting training/workshops for participants of the "Science4Business - Science for business" project (project no.: FENG.02.05-IP.07-0002/24, hereinafter referred to as: "S4B" or "Project").<br> Training and workshops will be organized as part of Task No. 2 "Technology transfer staff", implemented by the National Center for Research and Development as part of the above Project. The aim of task no. 2 is to build a specialized training program and workshops for employees of Technology Transfer Centers (CTT) and Special Purpose Vehicles (SC), including people managers involved in technology transfer and training of current staff to fill competence gaps. The training program will be adapted to the level of knowledge and experience of training and workshop participants.<br> The order will include 3 editions/cycles of training for employees CTT and SC. Within each edition/series, the following will be conducted in parallel:<br> • training for employees who do not perform managerial functions. They will be implemented at 3 levels of advancement (basic, intermediate and advanced). Each cycle will last from four to thirteen months. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: LESSER POLAND VOIVODESHIP. Summary: Organizing and Conducting a Series of Training Courses on Adaptation to the Effects of Climate Change. Description: 1. The subject of the order is the organization and conduct of a series of training sessions (12 meetings) for adaptation specialists employed under the LIFE DREAM CITIES project entitled: Designing and implementing a model adaptation among medium-sized cities "Maopolska ready for adaptation". Every training organized will be for a minimum of 15 and a maximum of 20 people indicated by the Ordering Party. 2. Participants will be people with a higher education diploma. 3. The training plan should take into account that at least 30% of classes should consist of practical classes (seminars, exercises, project exercises).4. Contractor obliged is to issue course completion certificates to all participants at the end of the training.5. A detailed description of the subject of the order (SOPZ) is included in Annex No. 1D to the procurement contract and will be included as an annex to the contract.6. The conditions for the execution of the order are included in the draft provisions public procurement contract, which will be included in the content of this contract - contract template and constitutes Annex No. 1C to the contract documents (hereinafter referred to as the contract template contracts).. Published Date: 2025-12-06. Closing Date: 2025-12-15. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Organizing and Conducting a Series of Training Courses on Adaptation to the Effects of Climate Change

The subject of the order is the organization and conduct of a series of training sessions (12 meetings) for adaptation specialists employed under the LIFE DREAM CITIES project entitled: Designing and implementing a model adaptation among medium-sized cities "Maopolska ready for adaptation". input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: KOTLIN COMMUNE. Summary: "Purchase of a Mini Excavator on Tracks as Part of the Budget Task Entitled: Purchase of a Backhoe Loader. Description: Purchase of a mini excavator on tracks as part of the budget task entitled: purchase of a backhoe loader with the procedure number ZP.271.10.2025. The subject of the order is the delivery service of a brand new mini tracked excavator (no accidents), with EU approval and equivalents, CE declaration and instructions in Polish. At the same time, the Contractor will ensure training of designated employees in the operation and use of the supplied equipment, which must be adapted for outdoor storage. The minimum requirements regarding the subject of the order are described in Annex No. 6 to SWZ - Description of the subject of the order. (OPZ).. Published Date: 2025-12-06. Closing Date: 2025-12-12. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Detailed requirements for the implementation of the order have been included in Appendix No. 1.1 to the SWZ Description of the subject of the order (OPZ) for part I of the order, other terms of the order execution are included in Appendix No. 7.1 to the SWZ Draft provisions of the contract for part Izamwienia.

The scope of the order includes performing the duties of an animator in the period from signing the contract to June 30, 2027. The hour of providing animation services should be understood as clock hours, i.e. 60 minutes. The Ordering Party assumes that the maximum number of hours of environmental animation will be 276 hours in a given month; 69 hours in a given week. Scope of training: expanding practical knowledge in the field of population protection and civil defense based on the Act of December 5, 2024 on population protection and civil defense (Journal of Laws of 2024, item 1907). recognizing and preventing threats, and shaping appropriate behavior in the event of their occurrence, developing the ability to cooperate between civil protection authorities and civil protection entities in the district when responding to emerging threats; The training is to meet the requirements of the Regulation of the Minister of Interior and Administration on programs training in the field of civil protection and civil defense and requirements for entities conducting training of February 6, 2025 (Journal of Laws 2025, item 162). input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: WEST POMERANIAN VOIVODESHIP. Summary: Comprehensive Provision of First Aid Training Services for Staff Providing Social Services in the West Pomeranian Voivodeship. Description: Comprehensive development and implementation of 18 training courses with the same content for participants of the ROPS training project. The subject of the order in Part 1 is the comprehensive provision of training services for the needs of 18 training courses with the same content on the subject of providing first aid to children, adolescents, seniors and people with disabilities. The training will be addressed to staff from the West Pomeranian Voivodeship who provide social services in the local environment. The aim of organizing the school is to acquire competences by staff providing social services in the local environment in the field of basics of providing first aid for children and adolescents, the elderly and people with disabilities of the locomotor/visual/hearing organs. The training will be addressed to a maximum of 360 people from the West Pomeranian Voivodeship, representatives of entities and institutions providing social services in the local community. Participation in the training and the acquisition of competences is intended to support the development of high-quality social services, including those provided in the local community.. Published Date: 2025-11-19. Closing Date: 2025-11-27. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: NATIONAL CENTER FOR RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT. Summary: Providing Training Services by Organizing and Conducting Training/Workshops for Participants of the "Science4business - Science for Business" Project. Description: 1. The subject of the order is the provision of a training service by organizing and conducting training/workshops for participants of the "Science4Business - Science for business" project (project no.: FENG.02.05-IP.07-0002/24, hereinafter referred to as: "S4B" or "Project").<br> Training and workshops will be organized as part of Task No. 2 "Technology transfer staff", implemented by the National Center for Research and Development as part of the above Project. The aim of task no. 2 is to build a specialized training program and workshops for employees of Technology Transfer Centers (CTT) and Special Purpose Vehicles (SC), including people managers involved in technology transfer and training of current staff to fill competence gaps. The training program will be adapted to the level of knowledge and experience of training and workshop participants.<br> The order will include 3 editions/cycles of training for employees CTT and SC. Within each edition/series, the following will be conducted in parallel:<br> • training for employees who do not perform managerial functions. They will be implemented at 3 levels of advancement (basic, intermediate and advanced). Each cycle will last from four to thirteen months. Accurate the duration of each cycle will be determined jointly by the Contractor and NCBR after signing the contract i<br> •separate workshops for CTT/SC management staff.<br> In all three editions/cycles, a total of 400 training places are planned for non-managerial employees and 100 .... Published Date: 2025-11-17. Closing Date: 2025-12-15. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Description: provision of the SOC (Security Operation Center) service consisting in continuous monitoring, analysis and response to incidents related to cybersecurity of the Hospital's ICT infrastructure. The subject of the order includes: 1) Security monitoring along with with identification of dangerous events within the SOC on a continuous basis: 24/7/365, 2) Launch of the SIEM (Security Information and Event Management) environment, 3) the environment in which the SOC and SIEM service is implemented will be run on a dedicated environment high HA availability in a professional Data Center certified in accordance with the PN-EN ISO/IEC 27001 standard or equivalent (requires meeting TIER minimum III), 4) Support in the SIEM system, minimum 300 EPS (event per second), 5) Number of log sources: maximum 20, including Windows servers, Linux servers (various distributions) and network devices.6) Establishing, securing and handling connections between the Ordering Party and the SOC by launching an encrypted data transmission link in VPN IP MPLS or VPN IP SEC technology,. Description: The subject of the order is the construction of a platform of electronic public services based on the purchase of an integrated e-services software package together with implementation works, in order to provide public e-services in the field of local taxes for residents and entrepreneurs at level 5 of e-maturity and making public e-resources available to residents. The main task of the project is to provide residents and entrepreneurs with one place with e-service records with a uniform and simple interface that will be able to guide the office's client through the process of implementing a given case in an easy way. Additionally as part of the project, a mobile application dedicated to customers will be made available, enabling the implementation of most services on mobile devices. The sphere of providing e-services to customers will include areas such as: 1) Online payments and in the mobile application regarding personalized fees (e.g. local taxes), 2) Personalized information regarding taxes, documents and financial relations with municipalities, 3) Integration with the National Electronic Identification System in the field of user authentication, 4) Communication using application.... Published Date: 2025-11-13. Closing Date: 2025-11-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: COMMUNE OF THE CITY OF SOCHACZEW. Summary: Conducting Educational and Training Classes in the Field of Civil Protection and Civil Defense. Description: The subject of the order is to conduct educational and training classes in the field of civil protection and civil defense for employees of the Municipal Office in Sochaczew, subordinate organizational units and residents of the city of Sochaczew, in accordance with the Regulation of the Minister of Interior and Administration of February 6, 2025. The main responsibilities of the contractor will include comprehensive organization and conduct of training in the field of civil protection and civil defense, including preparation of the schedule, implementation of the program, provision of teaching staff, training materials and teaching equipment, and preparation of documentation (attendance lists, reports, minutes). Participant groups: I Office management and employees approx. 137 people (2 days) II Directors of schools, kindergartens and units approx. 22 people (2 days) III Education employees approx. 684 people (1 day) IV Employees of units subordinated to the Mayor approx. 552 people (1 day) per day: approx. 1,395 people Groups of up to 40 people (2 days of training) and groups of up to 60 people (1 day). The task is financed from a special-purpose subsidy from the Masovian Voivodeship Office in Warsaw.. Published Date: 2025-11-08. Closing Date: 2025-11-17. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: SPECIALIZED PSYCHOLOGICAL AND PEDAGOGICAL COUNSELING CENTER. Summary: Providing Services in the Field of Early Development Support for Children as Part of the Comprehensive Support Program for Families "For Life" - Physiotherapy. Description: 1. The subject of the order is the provision of physiotherapy services for children as part of the comprehensive support program for families "For Life". Therapy services will be provided in the form of individual classes with children from birth until they start school.<br> For one hour of therapy a full clock hour (60 minutes) is assumed.<br> 2. The subject of the order was divided into 4 parts according to the expected number of hours (h) of the service:<br> - for part 1 of the procedure, the estimated minimum number of hours is 250 h<br> - for part 2 of the procedure, the estimated minimum number of hours is 500 h<br> - for part 3 of the procedure, the estimated minimum number of hours is 250 h<br> - for part 4 of the procedure, the estimated minimum number of hours is 300 h<br> 3. The allocated number of hours will depend on the number of children actually qualified for the program. For unused parts contract, the Contractor will not be entitled to any claims, except for payment for the service provided.<br> 4. The responsibilities of a specialist conducting individual physiotherapy for children include:<br> - after appointing a team of specialists for a specific child, establishing directions and a schedule activities undertaken in the field of early assistance and family support,<br> - establishing cooperation with the facility where the child is subject to other therapeutic activities in order to ensure coherence of interactions,<br> - developing and implementing an individual project together with the child and his family program.... Published Date: 2025-11-05. Closing Date: 2025-11-26. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: SOCIAL INSURANCE INSTITUTION. Summary: Purchase of Software to Monitor the Applications and Infrastructure of the Pue/Ezus Portal Along with Support. Description: I. The subject of the order is:<br> 1. delivery of a 48-month subscription for Software for monitoring the applications and infrastructure of the PUE/eZUS Portal (hereinafter: Software) in accordance with the requirements specified in Chapter II of Annex No. 7 to the SWZ,<br> 2. implementation of the delivered Software on all infrastructure elements indicated by ZUS - indicated in Table 1 - in accordance with the requirements specified in Chapter III of Annex No. 7 to the SWZ,<br> 3. providing Software maintenance services in accordance with the requirements specified in Chapter IV of Annex No. 7 to the SWZ,<br> 4. conducting workshops for administrators up to 240 man-hours in accordance with the requirements specified in Chapter V of Annex No. 7 to the SWZ. The Ordering Party guarantees the order to conduct workshops of min. 160 man-hours.<br> II. Order completion date:<br> 1. delivery and implementation of the Software will take place in within 60 days from the date of conclusion of the Agreement, but not earlier than January 1, 2026, provided that:<br> the technical design and draft schedule will be submitted for collection by the Ordering Party within 15 days from the date of conclusion of the Agreement;<br> documents indicated in point 1.1. will be subject to approval by the Ordering Party within 30 days from the date of conclusion of the Agreement;<br> 2. workshops for administrators will be conducted until the end of the Agreement;<br> 3. subscriptions for the Software (use of the Software) - 48 months from the start of work implementation.... Published Date: 2025-10-31. Closing Date: 2025-11-14. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: DISTRICT FAMILY ASSISTANCE CENTER IN ELBLĄG. Summary: Providing the Services of an Sdr Trainer (School for Parents) as Part of the Project Entitled: "A Better Start in Adult Life. Description: Specialized support for foster parents and RDDDuration: from the date of signing the contract to December 31, 2027 Support provided throughout the duration of the project in accordance with the reported demand for 14 Foster Families (13 years old and 8 months old) and 1 Family Children's Home (1 year old and 1 month old). The following activities are planned group: School for Parents (2 SDR Trainers responsible) A series of 10 meetings, 4-hour workshops each (10 x 4 hours, a total of 40 hours x 2 groups = 80 hours x 2 for 160 hours) thematically allowing for the strengthening of parental competences, including: shaping the child's ability to communicate and treat the child in dialogue, building correct relationships, shaping parental attitudes based on love and acceptance, self-respect, respect for others, and setting clear requirements and boundaries of mature, responsible and satisfying parenting for all family members, etc. During support group meetings, participants they will have the opportunity to share their own experience, consider various eventualities, and will also have the opportunity to translate theoretical knowledge into practical knitting.. Published Date: 2025-10-30. Closing Date: 2025-11-07. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: DISTRICT FAMILY ASSISTANCE CENTER IN ELBLĄG
output.Summary: Providing the Services of an Sdr Trainer (School for Parents) as Part of the Project Entitled: "A Better Start in Adult Life

The following activities are planned group: School for Parents (2 SDR Trainers responsible) A series of 10 meetings, 4-hour workshops each (10 x 4 hours, a total of 40 hours x 2 groups = 80 hours x 2 for 160 hours) thematically allowing for the strengthening of parental competences, including: shaping the child's ability to communicate and treat the child in dialogue, building correct relationships, shaping parental attitudes based on love and acceptance, self-respect, respect for others, and setting clear requirements and boundaries of mature, responsible and satisfying parenting for all family members, etc. During support group meetings, participants they will have the opportunity to share their own experience, consider various eventualities, and will also have the opportunity to translate theoretical knowledge into practical knitting.

The scope of the order includes, among others, supplies: 1) purchase server to the cluster - 1 pc. 2) disk array - 1 pc. 3) expansion of the current server to the cluster - 1 pc. 4) device for creating a backup copy on external media: Streamer, tape drive - 1 pc. 5) UPS to support key stations - 2 pcs. 6) UPS to support the UM Server Room - 1 pc. 7) power generator Unit - 1 pc. 8) access switch for UM - 1 pc. 9) access switches for OSIR, MGOPS - 2 pcs. 10) UTM for OSIR - 1 pc. 11) server for MGOPS - 1 pc. 12) NAS server for OSIR, MGOPS - 2 pcs. 13) NAC Network Access Control system for UM 14) SIEM software for UM -1pcs 15) EDR or XDR software as extension antivirus software -1 pc.16) NAS server for City Hall -1 pc.17) Specialized IT training -1 pc.. Published Date: 2025-10-28. Closing Date: 2025-11-04. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed
